definition: Brave and confident; in writing or printing, darker and heavier; a bold person or style.
examples: She made a bold decision to start a club.
Please use bold letters for the title.

extra.memory_tip: Bold = big, brave, and easy to see.

definition: Clever at getting what you want, sometimes by tricking; skill in achieving something by deceit or cleverness.
examples: The cunning fox escaped the trap.
With patience and cunning, she solved the puzzle.

definition: An action or something that someone does; also a legal document that shows ownership.
examples: Helping a neighbour is a kind deed.
They signed the deed to the house.

definition: To sleep lightly; a short, light sleep.
examples: He dozed on the sofa after lunch. (verb)
A quick doze helped her feel better. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Doze = a dose of quick sleep.

definition: Having sharp points or edges that are not even.
examples: We climbed over the jagged rocks.
Be careful of the jagged metal.

definition: Confident and hopeful; showing the presence of something; in maths, greater than zero; a confident statement.
examples: She has a positive attitude about learning.
The test was positive for bacteria.

extra.memory_tip: Positive = plus signs in mood and maths.

definition: A feeling of admiration; polite behaviour toward others; to admire and treat well.
examples: Show respect by listening quietly. (noun)
We respect our coaches and classmates. (verb)

definition: Having a duty to look after something or someone; able to be trusted to do what is right.
examples: You are responsible for feeding the class pet today.
She is a very responsible leader.

extra.memory_tip: Responsible = response-able: ready to answer for actions.

definition: To take things or people secretly and illegally from one place to another.
examples: They tried to smuggle rare birds across the border.
Stories warn against smuggling stolen goods.

extra.memory_tip: Smuggle = sneak and juggle past checks.

definition: A particular form of something that differs from others; a telling of events from one point of view.
examples: We downloaded the latest version of the app.
Each witness gave a different version of the story.
